9be6f6cd-b3e7-450a-a3c7-138cb2d8e791.description: Earners of the Human Bloodborne Pathogen Exposure (HBPE) badge have a comprehensive understanding of safe work practices in a work environment where students can be exposed to bloodborne pathogens. They have learned general safety issues with pathogens, bloodborne diseases, risk assessment, and recommended work practices for environments where blood-borne pathogens are present.
9be6f6cd-b3e7-450a-a3c7-138cb2d8e791.name: HBPE

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Human Bloodborne Pathogen online course

8f998aac-684f-4d11-834c-79a228bfaf62.description: Through this course, badge earners will have improved their ability to advance the business imperative of Inclusion in a diverse workplace, thereby strengthening the organization's culture and increasing its productivity. Identifying and practising inclusive attitudes and mindsets, interrupting biases, promoting inclusive attitudes and mindsets are skills that will be learned and demonstrated through end of module quizzes.
8f998aac-684f-4d11-834c-79a228bfaf62.name: Inclusion at Work

badge_template_activities.title: Online Course Completion (minimum 3 out of 5 on each of 5 modules)

f93ee147-744a-4a69-a4e8-94fe78b437d1.description: Earners of the Palliative Care workshop will have learnt what palliative means, MAID, conscious sedation, advanced directives, and goals of care. Signs and symptoms of end of life and how best to meet a loved ones needs are understood. Caring for a palliative loved one is not an easy choice and the earner will have understood making the decision of taking on the role of a caregiver. Impact of grief will be discussed with tips on how to maintain self while caring for your loved one.
f93ee147-744a-4a69-a4e8-94fe78b437d1.name: Caregiver Palliative Care

alignments.name: Health Care Aide
alignments.description: Curriculum from the Family Caregiver workshops follow the standards of the accredited HCA program at NorQuest College. Skills are pulled that we expect a Family Caregiver can practice safely. Completion of the course does not contribute to completing a HCA program in Alberta.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 1 hour  theory lecture.

Participate a 1 hour simulation experience in the form of an acted scenario. In simulation, the badge earner practiced providing care and decision-making skills through a real-life situational experience related to the workshop topic.

738bf6cf-1841-48ac-8916-61c0a4b8757f.description: Earners of the Process Improvement Fundamentals badge will have an understanding of the fundamentals of process development including Lean and Quality Management, and how to monitor and manage a project to ensure that project objectives are achieved.
738bf6cf-1841-48ac-8916-61c0a4b8757f.name: Process Improvement Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Process Improvement Fundamentals course

722fd705-38cf-40e5-bd11-8f36203c2869.description: Earners of the Family Caregiver- Navigating the Healthcare System learnt about the structure of the Alberta Health Care system, the caregivers role within the system, resources within the area and techniques for communicating with health-care providers to meet the needs of care recipients and caregivers. The workshop also focuses on helping caregivers identify care needs using the Care Support Needs Assessment Tool (CSNAT).
722fd705-38cf-40e5-bd11-8f36203c2869.name: Caregiver Health Navigation

alignments.name: Health Care Aide
alignments.description: Curriculum from the Family Caregiver workshops follow the standards of the accredited HCA program at NorQuest College. Skills are pulled that we expect a Family Caregiver can practice safely. Completion of the course does not contribute to completing a HCA program in Alberta.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 1 hour  theory lecture.

Participate a 1 hour simulation experience in the form of an acted scenario. In simulation, the badge earner practiced providing care and decision-making skills through a real-life situational experience related to the workshop topic.

cd6d9908-eed4-4639-bc12-a469d188abc6.description: Earners of the Family Caregiver- Supporting a Person with Dementia: Guidance for the Caregiver have learnt the differences between disorientation, delirium and dementia. Progression of stages and symptoms of dementia were covered along with common responsive behaviours and how the badge earner can manage them while maintaining composure. Self-care for the caregiver will be highlighted in this workshop along with different assistive devices to help manage wandering behavior and safety.
cd6d9908-eed4-4639-bc12-a469d188abc6.name: Caregiver Dementia Care

alignments.name: Health Care Aide
alignments.description: Curriculum from the Family Caregiver workshops follow the standards of the accredited HCA program at NorQuest College. 3252a661-5913-4d0e-b3f0-c81e5bcbb179.description: This Leadership Program has been designed to move learners forward on their leadership journey to build upon learning and skills acquired in their roles, and to apply this learning at the end of the program through the completion of an Action Learning Project. The courses completed include: Myself as a Leader: Discovery of Leadership Style; Communicating Effectively; Leading Dynamic Teams; Myself as a Leader - Self Awareness and EQi; Leading through Conflict; and Leading Through Change.
3252a661-5913-4d0e-b3f0-c81e5bcbb179.name: Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of six courses: Myself as a Leader: Discovery of Leadership Style; Communicating Effectively; Leading Dynamic Teams; Myself as a Leader - Self Awareness and EQi; Leading through Conflict; and Leading Through Change.

fa1a82c8-9122-4402-aa60-017c758ad779.description: Earners of the Difficult Conversations badge will have learned about why difficult conversations arise, what our role is this escalation may be, and the tools and techniques to plan and execute a difficult conversation.
fa1a82c8-9122-4402-aa60-017c758ad779.name: Difficult Conversations

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will be given the chance to participate in discussions regarding difficult conversations based on personality style

f09012ea-3816-43f1-9cdf-9c80fb29b522.description: Earners of the Family Caregiver- Mealtime and Medication Assistance Workshop have learnt techniques focusing on safe medication assistance, and managing mealtime for a person with dementia, and dysphagia (choking), which includes tips for food consistency. The goal is to maintain a family connection. Badge earners have also learnt effective communication, tools to assist, understand modifications for the recipient's’ abilities and observe health status to notify health care personnel of changes.
f09012ea-3816-43f1-9cdf-9c80fb29b522.name: Caregiver Meal & Meds

58013ce7-0ad4-4f75-975a-ec9ab2870041.description: Earners of the Family Caregiver- Effective Communication learnt about Nonviolent communication techniques that promote effective communication, explored blocks to effective communication and how to avoid them and discuss causes of conflict and ways to resolve conflict. During the workshop, earners emphasized discussion of strategies to apply during the earner's own caregiver situation.
58013ce7-0ad4-4f75-975a-ec9ab2870041.name: Caregiver Effective Communication

Collaborate badge have been recognized for demonstrating the skill of collaboration in both a 4-month classroom setting and a 2-month work experience. Earners of this badge have demonstrated skills such as teamwork, accountability, and adaptability. NorQuest College and Douglas College are proud partners of the Autism CanTech! Program. For more information please view the Additional Details link.

Receive an Employability Skills Assessment (ESAT) score of 4.0 or higher on a 6.0 point scale for all 3 competencies from their work experience supervisor.

209393e3-6f1c-46ad-ae45-d3c91c5101a7.description: Earners of the Family Caregiver- Assisting with Personal and Intimate Care Workshop have learnt how to adjust to changing roles within the family when the caregiver needs to assist with personal care such as bathing, dressing and incontinence care while still maintaining the dignity of the care recipient. They have also learnt effective communication, tools to assist, understand modifications for the recipient's’ abilities and observe health status to notify health care personnel of changes.
209393e3-6f1c-46ad-ae45-d3c91c5101a7.name: Caregiver Personal Care

91e3ade5-6772-441d-b961-9f479fe7e9c2.description: Earners of the Pain Monitoring and Management workshop will have learnt the various types of pain, differences between chronic and acute pain, effects of pain on quality of life, and how as a caregiver the badge earner can make observations of your loved one and help identify ways to manage their pain. Pharmacological and non-pharmacological methods of management were also discussed. Myths have be dispelled and caregiver support highlighted.
91e3ade5-6772-441d-b961-9f479fe7e9c2.name: Caregiver Pain Management

f1c9a17e-11a3-463e-8c78-f098d5130086.description: This interactive and engaging workshop provides participants with an awareness of the legislation and the importance of respectful behaviours associated with fostering a respectful workplace. Participants will engage in conversation around risk mitigation and everyone’s level of responsibility and accountability. The workshop includes dialogue around how to deal with situations when they arise in the workplace through actual case studies.
f1c9a17e-11a3-463e-8c78-f098d5130086.name: Respectful Workplace

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the Respectful Workplace Workshop

7903af45-1739-4345-83ee-fc239fabfe3a.description: Earners of the Family Caregiver- Assisting with Mobility-Safe Practices Workshop have learnt proper body mechanics; Identify causes of falls and strategies to prevent them; assess and manage personal safety and risk of injury with mobility assistance; and determine actions to take when a fall occurs. They have also learnt effective communication, tools to assist, understand modifications for the care recipient's’ abilities and observe health status to notify health care personnel of changes.
7903af45-1739-4345-83ee-fc239fabfe3a.name: Caregiver Mobility

d0daf71b-80c9-4684-a9f8-2e81d017d3fc.description: This interactive workshop provides participants with the skills necessary to: turn a difficult situation into an opportunity for relationship building; use positive language to establish rapport and trust; effectively acknowledge the customer’s point of view; use phrases that help convey empathy and understanding; take responsibility for resolving the situation; successfully end an interaction on a positive note; take initiative to follow through and follow up.
d0daf71b-80c9-4684-a9f8-2e81d017d3fc.name: Communication and Customer Service

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the Communication and Customer Service workshop

b82b7bf0-b7f7-44d7-ac25-2608edc274ea.description: Earners of this communicator badge have the ability to effectively communicate in all situations. Their skills include good eye contact, clear writing, active listening and professional speech.
b82b7bf0-b7f7-44d7-ac25-2608edc274ea.name: Communicator

Complete six workshops focused on skill development as part of the Career Moves program

4b59de65-9e37-4833-8989-86385ce1c08e.description: Earners of the Family Caregiver- All You Need to Know About Infection Control and Prevention Workshop have learnt how infections are spread, ways they can protect themselves and their loved ones, physical ways to prevent the spread of infection and tips to maintain these practices. They have also learnt effective communication, tools to assist, understand modifications for the recipient's’ abilities and observe health status to notify health care personnel of changes.
4b59de65-9e37-4833-8989-86385ce1c08e.name: Caregiver Infection Prevention

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 2 hour theory lecture that includes case studies and videos.

457e4f2e-079c-4eff-8c90-afe967128002.description: Earners of this badge move forward on their leadership journey to build upon learning and skills acquired in their roles and to apply this learning at the end of the program through the completion of an Action Learning Project. The courses completed include Communicating Effectively, Presentations with Impact, Developing Dynamic Teams, Effective Time Management and Delegation, Leading with Influence, Coaching for Impact, Difficult Conversations – Leading Through Conflict, and Leading Change.
457e4f2e-079c-4eff-8c90-afe967128002.name: Leadership Lab

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all of the courses in the Leadership Lab program

4938f247-6e19-4a44-9a81-fb13003a702d.description: Earners of this self-empowered badge are able to take control of their life and make positive choices. They are competent in skills such as self-awareness, responsibility, confidence, and honesty.
4938f247-6e19-4a44-9a81-fb13003a702d.name: Self-Empowered

Complete six workshops focused on skill development as part of the Career Moves program

748aed7a-59cf-4be9-a8ca-e486f85f53a9.description: Earners of the Cannabis Trimming & Production: online course badge have a fundamental understanding of cannabis production in Canada. Earners are able to describe the cannabis plant and the regulations governing its production, as well as identify quality control issues during harvesting and packaging. These candidates are able to properly handle the cannabis plant to prevent contamination, carefully harvest and trim the plant, and follow standard operating procedures.
748aed7a-59cf-4be9-a8ca-e486f85f53a9.name: Cannabis Trimming & Production: online course

cea71323-165e-487f-8ba6-6671ecedb743.description: Earners of this critical thinker badge have the ability to analyze facts and information to make an informed conclusion. They are able to use logic and are competent in skills such as observation, objective reasoning, and data analysis.
cea71323-165e-487f-8ba6-6671ecedb743.name: Critical Thinker

16f25471-b589-484f-b417-af29ce19d901.description: Earners of this entrepreneurial badge have the ability to start new ideas or projects, set goals, and follow through. They are competent in skills such as leadership, initiative, and creative thinking.

b3d07662-b8ea-4e4d-9649-c395aa259f3b.description: Earners of the Career Ready badge will develop key skills necessary to find and maintain employment. Learners explore industry-valued transferrable skills and professionalism, understanding ways to demonstrate their workforce relevance to employers and hiring managers, and working towards the goal of life-long employability.
b3d07662-b8ea-4e4d-9649-c395aa259f3b.name: Career Ready

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Career Ready course

f72b979c-04b6-46b4-bfc8-71b1d9d49b48.description: This Managerial Leadership badge is comprised of modules that assist learners in understanding key insights into their unique leadership style and help them identify personal development opportunities for themselves as leaders. The badge will cover a wide range of topics including personal leadership style, personal brand, design thinking, emotional intelligence, and agile leadership.
f72b979c-04b6-46b4-bfc8-71b1d9d49b48.name: Managerial Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete an Action Learning Project to complete this badge

0bba9691-9b25-4db4-899d-2ad509cc79b5.description: Earners of this problem solver badge are able to recognize a problem and find possible solutions. They have the ability to make good decisions, including determining the best course of action and carrying out the most effective solution.
0bba9691-9b25-4db4-899d-2ad509cc79b5.name: Problem Solver

Complete six workshops focused on skill development as part of the Career Moves program

aaf9f2d6-23af-4c03-b2fe-842c7c9ce2f3.description: Earners of the Hemp Processing & Products course can describe the processing methods and products that are derived from industrial hemp for food, fibre, health products, and CBD extraction. Earners are able to identify markets for industrial hemp in Canada and understand the different options for the more than 10,000 products that are made from hemp, such as textiles, plastics, cosmetics, food, and construction materials.
aaf9f2d6-23af-4c03-b2fe-842c7c9ce2f3.name: Hemp Processing & Products

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Hemp Processing & Products online courses or in-person training

05bc8978-e3e2-4e46-b557-6a48c9fa1d1a.description: This course will introduce concepts informing Equity, diversity and Inclusion in organizations and organizational community development, in a Canadian context. The course participants will be introduced to diverse approaches to EDI advocacy and leadership, at the individual and organizational levels, that will inform development of skills/competencies needed to frame and support EDI work.
05bc8978-e3e2-4e46-b557-6a48c9fa1d1a.name: Introduction to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Business Case for EDI Presentation
Complete the course and summative assessments

6bfdc523-f4ab-468e-ab7e-04992cee6758.description: The Prevention of Infection & Transmission course aims to help public facing employees feel safe and to communicate public health measures to the public. Earners of the badge have learnt: 1) Psychological safety in the workplace; 2) Leadership/ effective communication; 3) How infection occurs and how to break the chain of transmission; 4) Current public health regulations; 5) Hierarchy of Controls; 6) Proper PPE use; 7) Intro WHMIS; 8) Cleaning principles; and 9) What to do during an outbreak.
6bfdc523-f4ab-468e-ab7e-04992cee6758.name: Workplace- Prevention of Infection

alignments.name: OHS regulations and IPAC standards and guidelines
alignments.description: OHS Global (https://www.ohsglobal.ca/) and Infection Control Training Group (https://ictg.ca/) developed modules 2-10. Module 1 was developed and delivered by Creating People Power (http://www.creatingpeoplepower.ca/). The scenarios were created by OntheJob (http://www.onthejob.ai/).

badge_template_activities.title: 21 hour course. Modules include: 1) Fostering Psychologically Safe Workplaces; 2) Leadership and Effective Communication; 3) Introduction to Infectious Disease Outbreaks/Pandemics; 4) Regulations: The Rules and Guidelines; 5) Personal Protective Equipment & Clothing; 6) Intro WHMIS; 7) Cleaning Principles; 8) What to do when an Outbreak occurs; 9) Specialized requirements; and 10) Summary

At the end of the course, earners were guided through a story with three scenarios. This gamified solution helps the badge earner review course material, retain information better and apply knowledge and skills to a real life scenario.

skills.name: Risk Assessment And The Hierarchy Of Control

fd32e86f-639d-4c1f-8293-fbee4c7d3fa0.description: Earners of this adaptable badge have the ability to react in a positive way to both expected and unexpected changes. They are competent in skills such as responsibility and positive communication.
fd32e86f-639d-4c1f-8293-fbee4c7d3fa0.name: Adaptable

Practice real-world application of this skill during workshop activities, networking events, work-integrated learning opportunities, or during the Career Moves program.
Complete six workshops focused on skill development as part of the Career Moves program

f807bcf1-c384-4f99-ae81-8b4855eb1a7c.description: Earners of this confident badge have the ability to express their own value to others and believe in their own capability. They are competent in skills such as public speaking, self-assurance, and self-awareness.
f807bcf1-c384-4f99-ae81-8b4855eb1a7c.name: Confident

Complete six workshops focused on skill development as part of the Career Moves program

87a8cabd-4041-46b8-a179-cd1dda66cd92.description: Earners of the Cannabis Trimming & Production: on-site training badge have a minimum of 3 days in-person experience handling and cultivating cannabis at a commercial licensed cultivator facility. Earners are able to harvest, trim, and separate cannabis plant parts based on end uses. They know how to properly manage and record trim waste and have experience interpreting and following standard operating procedures.
87a8cabd-4041-46b8-a179-cd1dda66cd92.name: Cannabis Trimming & Production: on-site training

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Cannabis Trimming & Production: on-site training by attending three days of on-site experiential learning at a Canadian licensed cultivator.

Apply skills and knowledge gained through the Cannabis Trimming & Production online course to cannabis harvesting, trimming, and production in real-world applications at a Canadian licensed cultivator.

4e6e6dfe-ff1f-4396-98eb-901c60ef683f.description: The Inspiring Teams badge is comprised of modules allowing learners to acquire key insights about how to coach and develop others to build an engaged workplace. Learners will gain frameworks and support for leading within the culture of their team, project or organization. The badge will cover a wide range of topics including effective communication, coaching, social impact, talent and culture development.
4e6e6dfe-ff1f-4396-98eb-901c60ef683f.name: Inspiring Teams

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete an Action Learning Project to complete this badge

61271a0d-209a-45c5-94d1-92ce256bad48.description: Those who earn the Data Fundamentals for Business badge learn the fundamentals of data for business strategy, including governance and introductory math, and leave the workshop understanding how data is used to solve a variety of introductory business problems using modern software applications such as Microsoft PowerBI and SQL.
61271a0d-209a-45c5-94d1-92ce256bad48.name: Data Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Data Fundamentals for Business course

8932e2b4-ab9a-4d10-9d8e-8751fbc556dc.description: This EDI Essentials Program has been designed to focus managers and leaders on specific challenges and opportunities in building and sustaining an inclusive workplace. Topics will concentrate on enablers and inhibitors to inclusion, including Why EDI and AR Matter, Microaggressions, Inclusive Language, Allies and Allyship, and Different Perspectives on Equity, Justice and Anti-Racism Work in Organizations.
8932e2b4-ab9a-4d10-9d8e-8751fbc556dc.name: EDI Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the EDI Essentials course

bfcfb6b4-0df6-4e1c-8761-3451a1df62ef.description: Earners of this interculturally aware badge have the ability to act appropriately and effectively with people of different cultures and backgrounds. They are competent in skill such as open-mindedness, tolerance, respect, empathy, and cultural awareness.
bfcfb6b4-0df6-4e1c-8761-3451a1df62ef.name: Interculturally Aware

Practice real-world application of this skill during workshop activities, networking events, work-integrated learning opportunities, or during the Career Moves program.
Complete the workshop Intercultural Competency as part of the Career Moves program.

4951f146-1493-4e5e-aeb3-4c0afa4c772d.description: Taught by experienced local professionals, this Managerial Excellence microcredential program will teach you the skills and framework that businesses are using today. The program is designed to be highly focused and interactive so that you will develop strategic management and leadership skills in just 12 weeks. You will earn a microcredential certificate upon completion of the program, which is comprised of three badges: Managerial Leadership, Inspiring Teams, and Organizational Management.
4951f146-1493-4e5e-aeb3-4c0afa4c772d.name: Managerial Excellence

badge_template_activities.title: Managerial Leadership
Inspiring Teams
Organizational Management

dd318077-38ba-4ee1-8308-60391d8984a1.description: The Organizational Management badge is comprised of modules that provide tools and new ways of thinking to help learners make better tactical and strategic decisions in their organization. It will cover a wide range of topics including organizational governance, financial acumen, risk management, digital transformation and trends for the future.
dd318077-38ba-4ee1-8308-60391d8984a1.name: Organizational Management

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete an Action Learning Project to be eligible for this badge

82fceb7a-22c3-43e8-acc6-1306b376d650.description: Earners of the Hemp Farming badge have an excellent understanding of the realities of growing hemp for conventional and organic production for a variety of scales and climates. Earners are able to apply for a Health Canada license, understand the technical aspects of seeding and growing, and modify equipment for harvesting. They can also trouble shoot issues that arise while growing and harvesting hemp crops, and can identify the different markets and processors for purchasing finished crops.
82fceb7a-22c3-43e8-acc6-1306b376d650.name: Hemp Farming

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Hemp Farming online course or in-person training

They will also have a good grasp of techniques to improve adult learning and engagement, the ability to communicate complex information and processes in a simplified format, and be comfortable instructing others in a singular or group setting. Learners will have a good grasp of the curricula expectations of the ni

There will also be a mandatory shadowing of an actual workshop to gain practical experience.

5d23cb14-f274-4171-82b4-1717f63addf8.description: This Management Development Program has been designed to introduce the leaders to the fundamentals of leadership; leadership styles, team dynamics, communications, and change provide tools necessary to excel in their roles. The courses completed include Management Fundamentals, Management, Communication and Culture, Difficult Conversations, Respectful Workplace and EDI Essentials for Leaders.
5d23cb14-f274-4171-82b4-1717f63addf8.name: Management Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: The courses completed include Management Fundamentals, Management, Communication and Culture, Difficult Conversations, Respectful Workplace and EDI Essentials for Leaders.

53ff921f-ddfd-40d7-a9ad-99d7ec28e241.description: The Global Citizenship Boot Camp badge provides a series of workshops and reflections to strengthen students' confidence and preparedness for travelling abroad while building their intercultural knowledge and competences. The Boot Camp is a rich and innovative learning experience that will reduce barriers to studying and working abroad. The Boot Camp delivers content specifically designed to broaden access and equity while building global competencies.
53ff921f-ddfd-40d7-a9ad-99d7ec28e241.name: Global Citizenship

079cc778-9418-4b58-8eb8-b6a185c748ba.description: A skilled facilitator responsible for ensuring that presenters do their best job and participants get the most out of the session. They will employ conversational and other engagement skills to help ensure the conference session run smoothly.

7975e86c-d76d-4dda-a9ef-887c2c116e22.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated and validated their competency as an inclusive and accessible employer partner.
7975e86c-d76d-4dda-a9ef-887c2c116e22.name: Inclusive Leader

badge_template_activities.title: The accessibility competency is measured through the completion of 3-4 hours of asynchronous learning (moodle course) known as the ACT! Employer Partner Training with topic specific knowledge checks throughout the training.
Completion of hosting an ACT! student for a 200-hour work experience. This includes site visits and mid-point and final check in meetings with a Career Coach, student, and supervisor.

A minimum 30-minute consultation with the ACT! Inclusion & Accessibility Consultant where the consultant will work with the Employer Partner supervisor in the meeting to identify organizational needs to be a more inclusive and accessible workplace, and be provided with a next steps plan for them to implement.

110260f0-b282-46f8-9b05-7b198d563079.description: Earners of the NFPA 1021 – Fire Officer Level I badge have demonstrated, through theory and assignment based practical skill assessments, the qualities necessary to become a Company Officer at the Supervisory Level of the Fire Service. They have proven knowledge of the current trends influencing the fire service, the strengths presented by cultural diversity, the professional code of ethics practiced by fire departments, skills in budgeting, leadership, incident management, and more.
110260f0-b282-46f8-9b05-7b198d563079.name: NFPA 1021 Level I

d6bc153e-04ea-40e3-907b-23e8c07ae3af.description: Earners of the Flight Attendant Badge are prepared to apply as a commercial or corporate Flight Attendant. They have developed an understanding in basic flight theory and have demonstrated their knowledge for the industry. Earners of this badge have learned flight-specific emergency first aid and are assessed for their demonstration of evacuation drills.

dea3ad64-1e00-4509-8cec-911d366d6b4a.description: The Inclusion Certified badge is awarded to companies. Earners of the Inclusion Certified badge have seen 80% of their workforce successfully complete NorQuest College's online course, Inclusion at Work, and in so-doing have demonstrated their intent to build and foster an inclusive work environment. Inclusive companies have been shown to be highly effective, influential, and profitable, and are more likely to be identified as employers of choice.
dea3ad64-1e00-4509-8cec-911d366d6b4a.name: Inclusion Certified

badge_template_activities.title: When 80% of the organization's employee base has completed the course, the company will be awarded an Inclusion Certified Badge, valid for one year from date of receipt.

d0bb6732-b066-46ec-b1ed-bfcce8c247af.description: Earners of this badge value workplace diversity. They help to create a safe work environment, a sense of belonging, and acceptance for themselves and other colleagues.

43567bdc-0ff4-4bbe-bff2-ea3601f99e3e.description: In this session, participants are taught to recognize diversity in their workplace and how it can be an advantage to their organization. Participants develop the skills necessary to succeed within diverse teams to achieve the following outcomes: understanding how diverse team’s function; determining how judgements and pre-judgements can impact team success; recognizing the impact of cultural attitudes and behaviors on the bottom line; and create an inclusion skillset.
